website_summaries.verdict: Impressive everyday printer to meet a college student’s basic and even challenging printing needs.
pros: Set up for automatic duplex printing
Easy to set up via USB connection, compatible with Windows and Mac computers
Small in size, making it a good choice for a dorm
cons: Better for printing text rather than images or photos

website_summaries.verdict: A great deal on a basic laser printer that can handle card stock and other specialty papers.
pros: Toner lasts a long time, saving money in the long run
cons: Doesn't come with a USB cord

customer_reviews.title: GREAT printer. Here's how to reset toner count to get more from each ink cartridge/ drum count reset too.
customer_reviews.text: Amazing for the price. How to reset toner count (it tells you it's empty well before it is.): --Open front cover. leave it open. --Turn printer off. --Hold go button while turning printer on. --After 3 seconds of printer being back on, release both buttons. --Press Go button 9 times. -Yellow LEDs will lite up. --Press go button 5 times. --Close the cover. Toner is now reset. DRUM RESET ONLY: -Make sure that the machine is turned on. -Open the front cover. -Open front cover -Press and hold Go for about four seconds until all of the LEDs light up. Once all four LEDs are lit, release Go. -Close the front cover. -Make sure the Drum LED is now off.
customer_reviews.author: Master of Cats

customer_reviews.title: DOES NOT CONTAIN NEEDED USB CABLE
customer_reviews.text: This is a pretty cheapskate thing to do... charge me 3 dollars more but include all the pieces to use the printer in the box. It is absurd have to search the fine print of your product description to find out i'm missing some tiny inexpensive piece required to make the device function.
customer_reviews.author: Ian

customer_reviews.title: I'm very disappointed and feel I wasted my money
customer_reviews.text: Have had NOTHING BUT TROUBLE with this printer since purchase. Have purchased two drums because I was told that may be the problem as to why it's putting lines across every other page. As a court reporter, my transcript pages must be pristine, with no lines or blemishes. I'm now investing in a laser printer about three times the price of this one and hope that'll do the trick......at least it will hold twice as much paper as the tray with this printer holds and will print 21 more pages per minute than this one. I'm very disappointed and feel I wasted my money. Will now send to be recycled.
customer_reviews.author: PattyAnne

customer_reviews.title: Updated 2/16.  Still one star, but even worse than before
customer_reviews.text: Updated 2/16. So after buying the USB cable that doesn't come with this printer but requires it to function, it still doesn't work! I've tried reinstalling the drivers, calling Amazon tech support (useless waste of 20 minutes), restarting and shutting down my computer and all this STILL DOESN'T WORK. IS IT SO MUCH TO ASK THAT WHEN YOU BUY A PRINTER IT WORKS?! WELL BROTHER? IS IT?! Having a printer but not having a USB cable is like having a toy without batteries. Whoever was the genius that thought this would be a good idea should be fired.
customer_reviews.author: Joseph

customer_reviews.title: Inexpensive and efficient solution to everyday printing.
customer_reviews.text: The Brother line of the HL printers offer an inexpensive and efficient solution to everyday printing. I own the HLL2300D and a HL-227ODW and use one at work and one at home. The printers come packaged very well with clear instructions detailing how to get your printer up and running. The print speed is fast enough and the automatic double-sided printing is a huge bonus. The toner cartridge is cheap to replace and installs with a snap. The footprint of the printer is also very small so it takes up less desk space.
customer_reviews.author: Matt

customer_reviews.title: Works great for thick card stock and foiling projects
customer_reviews.text: I bought this to do foiling with, and it works great! Because a lot of people were saying that laser printers can't handle card stock, at first I was worried that my really thick card stock (120 lb. card stock/~236gsm) wouldn't go through. However, it works perfectly! I just use the single-sheet manual bypass and it goes through without a problem. I had to adjust the settings a little bit to get the toner to lay on densely to get the foil to stick properly to it. I set it to 600 DPI, Print density: 6, and set it to print 'Text' instead of 'Graphics'.
customer_reviews.author: Rebecca Wang

customer_reviews.title: Not sure what to do ...
customer_reviews.text: Only a few months after purchasing the printer, it announced one day that it was out of toner. No problem, I thought, I'll order another cartridge. Except when I installed the new cartridge, my computer could no longer recognize the printer. I re-installed the drivers. I tried calling Brother, to no avail, as their automated phone system keeps you on an endless loop. So, basically, after paying for a new printer and cartridge, I'm stuck with a lot of plastic. The problem is, every printer on the market does the same thing. What does one do?
customer_reviews.author: Scuzzy Magoo

customer_reviews.title: I bought it in January and has worked pretty well until 09/22/2016
customer_reviews.text: The duplex ability has quit working and now I am having to deal with the manufacturer. I bought it in January and has worked pretty well until 09/22/2016. I wish it would have lasted a little longer. I've been on hold with brother for 22 minutes and all they want to do is a computer trouble shoot. The problem with the printer is obvious because you see how the mechanism of the wheels on top not being able to pull the page back in for the duplex feature. They will not honor warranty and amazon will not help either. Do not buy because neither company will help even with the one year warranty still active.
customer_reviews.author: Solis

customer_reviews.title: pcb
customer_reviews.text: I bought this printer solely for making my own pcb boards (toner transfer). I used HP CG988A Color Laser Presentation Paper Which I also picked up here at Amazon. I had a perfect print out of the circuit board I was making and ran it through the AmazonBasics Thermal Laminator . I couldn't have been happier. I've read online that Brother printers will not work for pcb boards but I think with the paper I used it works great. There is a scratch on the top left which I did out of carelessness.
customer_reviews.author: Scott G. Nacke

customer_reviews.title: Printer works for about two toner cartridges worth--then won't
customer_reviews.text: OK--O do like these printers and they're at a good price. They will print seemingly forever on one cartridge. I'm on my 3rd printer. Yup, I've now had 3 of these. The hardware technology is beginning to age. I'll tell you why.....I connected printer #3, new toner cartridge. Went to print. Nada. worked on it for some time, finally read the failure note about USB2 vs USB3 connection. I'm running this directly to my PC. I checked the specs--this printer has only USB2 capability. So I switched USB ports and got it working again. I'll know about this next time I order a new printer, which is probably about a year away.
customer_reviews.author: C.V. Sharkey

customer_reviews.title: Can't print right out of the box - USB cable not included
customer_reviews.text: After setting up the printer, I was going to connect it to my computer as the instructions state, only to find that the USB cable is not included. Since it's not a WiFi or Bluetooth enabled printer, I think that's a very unprofessional tactic by the vendor. I read that they are unprofessional about their toner warning too. Not a great start.
customer_reviews.author: B. Puron

customer_reviews.title: Printer is Cheaper than the Ink
customer_reviews.text: In an era where the printer is cheaper than the ink, I've switched back to a monochrome printer. This affordable little printer prints all the small office stuff we need to print. The black ink is much cheaper than the multi-color printing cartridges we used to buy and overall I'm really happy with this purchase. I'm so happy in fact that I bought the exact same printer for my husband's office as well so he's not running through the house to print documents on mine. 3 Cheers!
customer_reviews.author: Angela Brown

customer_reviews.title: 60 Dollar Laser Printer that works.
customer_reviews.text: Got this printer in today, bought the (2) pack of additional tonner for 19.99 and the cable (both advertised below the product) Pulled it out of the box put the tonner in, plugged it in and ran the CD. Was printing fast and clean within 5 minutes of opening it up. This is exactly what I was looking for and very good price for what I needed.
customer_reviews.author: Just trying to help =)

customer_reviews.title: Easy to set up NO WIRELESS NO PROBLEM!
customer_reviews.text: EASY TO SET UP prints great and fast ! This is the easiest printer I’ve EVER set up! I hate HATE wireless ones as they were always losing connection. They were slow. I’ve had to take them and my computer to my work and have them set it up I’m the past. This one is AMAZING! No frills. It it printed within 20 minutes! No calibration needed. If you want just fast clear printing with EASY set up this is it!!! My grandkids ( under ten years old) could have done it! And the price? Super affordable ! Oh and I think since I’m just doing black and white that the cost for ink will be less.
customer_reviews.author: S. Hopkins

customer_reviews.title: NOT WIRELESS (but awesome!)
customer_reviews.text: totally didn't do my research and thought this was wireless. It is not! I still really like it though. I can print a ton of stuff and not have to worry about ink. Of course it's just black and white but it does what I want it for. I love love love the double sided printing! So useful. If you need a printer to just print random things that you may need, this is it!
customer_reviews.author: jbug

customer_reviews.title: Great printer but...
customer_reviews.text: I really like(d) this printer - inexpensive, compact, fast and sharp print - what more could you ask for in a printer? Well, for one thing, for it to keep working. First one quit after about a year. Just completely died. Either a fluke or planned obsolescence on the part of Brother. Ordered another one. The toner cartridge on the second one lasted about 100 pages and then said replace toner even though I know there's plenty of toner inside it. Doubt I would ever get another and hard to recommend it to others with these problems.
customer_reviews.author: Fixer

customer_reviews.title: Adequate budget printer
customer_reviews.text: I've been using this printer daily for 3 months, particularly during the quarantine period where I am homeschooling and printing worksheets for my kids to work on. The printer has decent quality (not super high resolution, but good enough for my purpose). It's fairly fast and quiet. It does have the annoying feature of saying the toner is out and not allowing you to print any further, but I was able to get around it with the instructions in the top review and thus I have gotten about another month of printing out of the unit. I love the duplex feature, allowing me to easily print double-sided. Overall very pleased with the printer for the price.
customer_reviews.author: Sara

customer_reviews.title: MANUAL FEED DESTROYS ENVELOPES & PRINTS CHECKS BADLY
customer_reviews.text: I am a low-volume user but I do need to print checks and envelopes. The manual feed does not hold the checks straight and they often come out printed at an angle and have to be reprinted. My envelopes invariably come out creased whether they are number 10 envelopes or 6 x 9 envelopes. This happens even though I set the media to "envelopes" or "heavy envelopes" Assume these problems are the result of manual feed problems. Normal paper seems to print OK (so far). Note: My last Brother printer 5450DN worked well but didn't last very long. I guess I'll try another manufacturer next time. Seems like Brother quality has gone downhill.
customer_reviews.author: Careful Buyer

customer_reviews.title: Can install because is missing the USB cable
customer_reviews.text: TRASHHHHHHH The toners have a certain print limit before the printer ask you to change toner even if toner has ink. this is pretty sad, I have to shake my toner and refresh the printer so it continues to print, the printer asks for new toner even thought pages come out with ink and no spotting. this printer should print regardless if i have ink or not and until i see a blank page come out then ill decide to get a new toner.
customer_reviews.author: Massie

customer_reviews.title: Only works for 1 day, then you must reinstall drivers
customer_reviews.text: Every time I used this thing I had to delete all driver files, reboot windows, reinstall drivers. Power down again, and pray. The only good day with this product was the day I smashed it with a hammer. Do Not Buy! I'll never purchase another brother branded porduct.
customer_reviews.author: TackdaySI

customer_reviews.title: Just an excellent basic monochrome laser printer
customer_reviews.text: I run a small medical practice and generally need 2 printers for my own use, one is an inkjet printer for various forms, cards, labels, envelopes etc. My main need is a good reliable basic black and white laser printer. I have just had this Brother HL2300D for a short while but it is perfect for my needs. The printer is crisp and clean. The machine is quiet and plenty fast. Setup was ridiculously easy. This is not a wifi printer but I didn't need that, so when I plugged in the USB A/B cable to my desktop iMac the setup was done in 10 seconds. I got this on sale on Amazon for $69.99, you can't beat that.
customer_reviews.author: David S.

customer_reviews.title: Never go back to inkjet.
customer_reviews.text: We've had the wireless version of this printer for a couple of years. My Mom ended up taking it when her printer died and so I bought this wired only version since we only used the printer in a wired configuration anyways. It's excellent for no-frills, low cost printing. Simple to setup, prints very quickly, easy to change out toner. Much more economical than an inkjet. It just works.
customer_reviews.author: David Pennington

customer_reviews.title: On Off Switch Does Not Work
customer_reviews.text: Update on my Review: My other 7 Brother printers have a toggle on off switch usually on the right hand side. This printer has one on the top front. Since writing my review, I found out that if I held the power button for at least 4 or more seconds it would turn off. The manual nor the quick set up instructions tell you that. I discovered it by accident. So that is the secret - simply hold down the power button for 4 or more seconds. I hope this update saves someone else the frustration that I went through trying to turn the printer off. Edit this post | Permalink
customer_reviews.author: Jim Diamond

customer_reviews.title: 2 years - This has been a great printer !!
customer_reviews.text: I would buy it again ! Great Machine ! Maintenance is a little tricky ! There is not a good video on UTUBE video for the HL-L2380DW drum replacement : ( The only trick is after the toner cartridge is installed in a new drum and put back into the printer the drum counter needs to be reset back to 100% . The # sign needs to be held " on" as part of the reset process but it is not lighted up on the top panel so put a piece of tape over it so that you can hold it down to finish the rest process
customer_reviews.author: TECH

customer_reviews.title: Great printer!
customer_reviews.text: Not too big, prints great! Various settings that allow toner savings and cost effective. Make sure you leave the side with the vent open if you place it on a closed bookcase. It needs space to vent heat from the laser. Generic toner refills as low as $10 on Amazon. Does duplex printing too. Much better than inkjet printers especially if your mainly interested in printing black and white! Doesn't do color or photo printing so any graphics are greyscale. Suggested use for all your non color printing. Save your inkjet for only color or photo printing and save lots of $$$!!!
customer_reviews.author: runhot

customer_reviews.title: No USB Cable Included?
customer_reviews.text: The printer setup requires that you connect the printer via USB cable to your computer. The printer doesnt come with this cable but the instructions are nice enough to recommend the specifications of a cable that will work best. What kind of nightmare hellscape are we living in where products do not come with the basic implements necessary to make them work any longer?
customer_reviews.author: Jonathan

customer_reviews.title: works great
customer_reviews.text: I didn't need a color printer, so I gave this product a try. Very good machine, prints out quickly and print quality is so clean. Toner cartridges go a long way. (I have been getting the aftermarket cartridges, with no problems). I would definitely buy it again. Good value for the $. I will upgrade to the wireless version for my next printer.
customer_reviews.author: Eric

customer_reviews.title: A decent printer.
customer_reviews.text: This prints clearly I’m black and white. It is the upgraded version of what I use at work. I was able to rig it up to my router to make it “wireless” but that took a bit of work on my part. I have not used customer support for anything and so I don’t have anything to say about that. What I don’t like is that once it goes to sleep (15 minutes I think) I have to walk over to it, press the power button to physically wake it up. It would be nice if just sending something to the printer, that it would wake up, but if that is my only complaint, then it’s not so bad.
customer_reviews.author: TMorse

customer_reviews.title: Worked right out of the box-Great
customer_reviews.text: I have Brother printer at another location that has worked like a charm for several years so I broke down and bought one for this location after putting it off because I had an older printer that sorta got the job done. It worked right out of the box as I am using the same computer I use at the other location. I didn't need to load a driver, used the printer cable from the other printer, loaded paper and printed a list from an app that I use frequently. Happy, happy.
customer_reviews.author: GKP

customer_reviews.title: Okay printer for the price. Doesn't include cable
customer_reviews.text: If this was a network printer I could understand not including a USB cable, but for a USB only printer it's a ridiculous choice to not include one in the packaging. You will have to buy a cable for this. The printer is 4 out of 5 stars but no cable brings my review down to 3. NOTE TO RASPBERRY PI USERS: This printer does not like ARM processors so you will have trouble getting this to work along side CUPS or as a printer for the Pi. The blaser drivers worked okay for me but not everything prints.
customer_reviews.author: M

customer_reviews.title: Why 1-star?  They didn't include a 25 cent USB printer cable!
customer_reviews.text: The printer is very good for what it's for. No complaints. My complaint is that they didn't include a cheap usb printer cable. The printer is not wi-fi but I knew that. I simply needed a printer cable. I live in a remote area and the nearest store that had one was Office Depot but they wanted $25!! I refused to pay that and ordered one from Amazon for $6. Later I saw that Home Depot sells them too. Go figure.
customer_reviews.author: Jack12

customer_reviews.title: Crisp and clear printing- can’t ask for anything better!
customer_reviews.text: This has been a surprisingly good purchase— surprising bc I wasn’t sure I would find more than one use for a monochrome printer but it’s been amazing to add to my home office. I initially purchased it to help me do toner-foil for my print orders (pic of business cards with this method) and have since used it for all kinds of office work. It’s easy to install (took just a few minutes) and it prints very clear text and photos! I’ve tried printing on thicker paper and it’s a mixed bag, but it handles regular paper and envelopes easily. Really pleased with this, would recommend.
customer_reviews.author: GreatDaneMama

customer_reviews.title: Exceptional Value
customer_reviews.text: Printer is quiet and prints pages much faster than my recently retired inkjet. One black cartridge for my old HP Deskjet sells for ~$48, which is equal to the price of a high-yield toner for the 2300. Buying a printer cable for an additional $5is a reasonable add-on; and using a 10-foot USB cable posed no problem--Brother suggests a maximum length of 6 feet, but the 10-foot cable works with the 2300. Setup was simple and the device began working on the first print command. I'm using Windows 8.1 with Start8 installed on a Dell PC.
customer_reviews.author: Practical Desk

customer_reviews.title: Worked right out of the box
customer_reviews.text: Popped in the toner, plugged in the power cord, connected to my laptop, and printed a page without having to download a driver. The CD Rom included with the unit doesn't list Windows 10, which is what I have, so it's useless. My OS saw the machine anyway and spit out the page right away. I ended up getting a new wire to connect to my laptop, though I probably could have used the wire from my old Brother printer, which conked out. Seven bucks at Walmart, no big deal. If I run into any of the problems others have mentioned, I'll edit the review but so far so good.
customer_reviews.author: floridian321

customer_reviews.title: My third one. And I'm a happy user.
customer_reviews.text: This is my third instance of this (and similar earlier Brother printers). I killed the first two printers eight and seven years ago each printing out over 10,000 pages (each double-sided) for a local political campaign. Fair enough, most people will never print out 10,000 pages. I'm very happy with this printer and it's earlier brethren. With this newer model, I was able to connect it through WiFi very easily. Unlike some other users, I have had no problem trying to print something once per week through WiFi while waking it up from sleep mode. And it's small and compact. So far I'm very happy with it.
customer_reviews.author: A. Frazer

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for Students!
customer_reviews.text: I bought this specifically for printing lecture materials and mandatory school forms. It's perfect! Prints quickly, can do double sided, and uses toners instead of ink. My only wish is that I had saved myself the frustration with other printers and bought this sooner. No more will I be fussing over colors that will never be used... Colors in which when they run out your printer is rendered completely useless due to the lack of volume in the Cyan container... no more buying ink cartridges that cost 25 cents to produce but are sold for more than an entire new printer... NO MORE. Monochrome is the future.
customer_reviews.author: Sarah Rose

customer_reviews.title: Undependable
customer_reviews.text: I bought this printer because of the good reviews the end of November 2018. It replaced a Brother Brother HL-2170W workhorse I had since 2010! This printer was easy to set-up, but not great printing , especially with different weights of paper: poor print quality, jamming, especially when duplexing. It stopped working In March of 2019...no power. Tried to contact Brother: their website is down, their phone lines are jammed . I'd stay away from it.
customer_reviews.author: Kendall Kay

customer_reviews.title: Cheap / hit or miss piece of hardware
customer_reviews.text: Been using PC's since DOS. It's pretty easy to hook up a printer and I use a Thermal zebra LP2844 quite often to do my label printing. Recently bought this Brother machine and it's just garbage. Installed using their latest driver package, showing up in windows 10 but just doesn't print. At best it printed out half a test page so far and cut itself off. To be honest it's kind of mind blowing that printers are still garbage.
customer_reviews.author: hugoeels

customer_reviews.title: Beats an HP anyday and everyday
customer_reviews.text: My trouble ridden hp ink jet all in one finally came to a point that it was unfixable and troubleshooting accomplished nothing. Having had a poor experience with HP printers over the years, I wanted to get something more reliable so I did soe research and learned a laser printer may be the way to go and I had read good things about brother so I gave this a try. It has been amazing. Plug and play with no troubleshooting. No wireless to fumble with, just simple functionality which is all I need. Silent when in rest mode and prints quickly but isn't very quiet and is also power hungry when in use. So far 9/10 would buy again
customer_reviews.author: Kennedy Edwards

customer_reviews.title: Printer intermittent
customer_reviews.text: I didn't install this for quite sometime as I got it for a new office location before the office was ready. Now it gets the paper light and I have to slam the paper draw closed hard to get it to work. It does it over and over. Now I had gone on vacation and back today and the support "closed" when I was gone. Beware of the times ............. they should have an automated system to remind us. I'm disappointed. This is my second brother laser because the first has lasted for years working great.
customer_reviews.author: EARVS

customer_reviews.title: Only good for a few months use
customer_reviews.text: This is my 2nd brother printer, I have had the same issue with both. After a few months of use the printer will get a low toner error code and after replacing toner the error will never go away and the printer will be useless and have a annoying beeping sound that will never go away no matter what. Just got of the phone with tech support and they couldn't give me the steps to clear this error code over the phone. Definitely not buying another brother printer
customer_reviews.author: Michelle Goshgarian

customer_reviews.title: Upgrade to old model, squeaks in 5 different places ...
customer_reviews.text: Upgrade to old model, squeaks in 5 different places after a month and parts of the page don't print right. The old brother I had printed 100 pages per day for 4 years and never had 1 problem, this thing wont last 3 months.
customer_reviews.author: J

customer_reviews.title: Fair and good to use
customer_reviews.text: Have run out of the original cartridge and guess I have used it for a while. Just a few highlights and personal opinion: (1) Seriously, why no USB cable? Never thought how frustrated your customers can be after finding out that they have to buy a USB cable separately? (2) Print speed is fine even with 2-side print. A little bit noise. (3) Paper jam happened several times and not so hard to deal with. It's a good design that multiple places can be opened up to deal with paper jam. (4) Please add Wi-Fi function!
customer_reviews.author: Daniel DeVos

customer_reviews.title: Best home laser printer
customer_reviews.text: The best home office laser printer. The toner lasts so much longer than inkjet. The best investment I’ve made for my school papers, planner inserts, legal documents, and other random projects. I purchase the generic toner drum here on amazon, making my saving even greater. Yay!
customer_reviews.author: Mandi

customer_reviews.title: A simple, efficient and reliable printer.
customer_reviews.text: There is, in my opinion, a rather prevalent issue with consumers reviewing products prematurely. I've owned this product for 6 months now, and can say with confidence it is a great product for home use at the very least. It prints quickly, crisply and seems to be quite efficient in that I am still using the original toner it came with. Another customer said here that the default toner is rated at 700 pages. It is also quite reliable, which is an issue I've had with printers in the past, suddenly running out of one toner or another. or printing unevenly. I highly recommend to anyone who wants a simple, efficient, and reliable printer for home use.
customer_reviews.author: Sotep

customer_reviews.title: Great printer so far
customer_reviews.text: I've been impressed with the quality of the prints and I'm excited to see how many pages I can get out of it. It works great with macOS and Linux. It's not wireless or networked, unfortunately. I was going to try to build a wireless print server out of my Raspberry Pi, but there are no official drivers from brother for ARM, as a heads up. There are open source drivers that kinda work, but not very well.
customer_reviews.author: FD

customer_reviews.title: Excellent for windows, not really suited for linux
customer_reviews.text: I use Fedora linux as my only operating system (well, not counting windoze under Virtual Box - I hardly ever use this anyway). When buying the Brother hl-l2300d I failed to check on whether a linux driver was available and it was a lot of trouble to get this printer to work under linux. However, it can be done. For about a year I could even print graphics (mostly photos) but no longer, no serious idea why (it's probably an issue of file size). Still, it works fine for text under linux. The Brother website does have a page devoted to linux support and the list of Brother printers addressed via that page does include the hl-l2300d.
customer_reviews.author: pasquale

customer_reviews.title: Acceptable for draft printing
customer_reviews.text: Ink flakes and scatters all over page, sometimes leave a big black border along the left. I would never print an important business letter with this thing, or waste good paper in it. The instructions for setup are terrible; took me two, 2-hour sessions of trial-and-error with driver downloads and messing around. It still sometime refuses to print for reasons unknown to me, but rebooting helps. With all that, I am not sure a more expensive machine would be much better, and we (two professional writers) use for drafts and utilitarian communication.
customer_reviews.author: Charles Desmarais

customer_reviews.title: Inadequate customer support, printer does not work
customer_reviews.text: I received my printer September 17 and still have not been able to get it set up. I have been back and forth with Brother’s customer support team for weeks but the support is entirely done over email and there is a delay of a few hours/days in between every response, which is really frustrating and not helpful. None of the troubleshooting advice has worked and I still am unable to connect my laptop to the printer so I can’t even print anything... completely frustrated with this experience and would strongly advise anyone thinking of purchasing a printer to think about purchasing from a different manufacturer due to the lack of timely customer support.
customer_reviews.author: Lisa M.

customer_reviews.title: Really good, affordable B&W laser.
customer_reviews.text: I'm on my second one of these; the first died when my 2 year old decided to pour a glass of milk in it a couple months ago, after we'd had it a couple of years (I think we bought the first one in 2014 or early 2015?). Waited for black Friday, and instantly snagged this one again without hesitation; that should say I'm pretty satisfied with it. It's not great for graphics--resolution is too low and it's B&W only. But for plain text printing it's awesome. Fast, cheap, cheap to operate, and--unless you douse it with liquid--pretty dang reliable. Works fine on our home network, warms up fast, prints fairly fast, very happy with it.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Best printer for college dorm. Edit: please read
customer_reviews.text: Excellent printer. Reliable fast printing, excellent ink efficiency. Looks good, tight profile. Update: Brother printers are nothing but a pain. The toner ran out and I bought a new one 68 bucks and installed it following all directions carefully. The printer still won't print and just continues to say replace toner. This is the second Brother I bought after the first one stopped working one day into having it. But now brother has screwed me over yet again. And yes I made sure all software was updated.
customer_reviews.author: Anatoly Spencer

customer_reviews.title: Great Price and Next Day Delivery!
customer_reviews.text: I love this printer. For the price you can't beat it. Only thing is that it doesn't come with the usb cord to connect to your computer, but that was inexpensive and I got it same day as the printer. I was not going to spend more than I had to, affordable and great quality, easy to install and I would recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Sonnya

customer_reviews.title: Plug and Play
customer_reviews.text: The best home printer ever. Just take it out the box, plug it in and print. No drivers or software needed or anything on Win 10. I updated the drivers with the one that came on the CD just in case and the printer printed 10 times faster. But I would never recommend installing their software or updating drivers from the web, from experience, that will cause the fake toners to stop working. Haven't tested fake toners yet but I'm sure they will work. USB CABLE NOT INCLUDED (don't forget)
customer_reviews.author: Geek

customer_reviews.title: Brother HL-L2300D Monochrome Laser Printer with Duplex Printing
customer_reviews.text: So Far This printer alway ben reliable Good quality printer for the office I,ve used inkjet printers in the past first one lasted 15 years other then lots of link and every other week of cleaning the heads the second one only lasted 3 years with parts consenley braking so I i've switched to brother laser printers I have not regretted doing to I'm same money on ink I get about 6,000 pages per toner that not bad other then i should have gotten one with the workgroup option for my network of computers still not a bad printer I would recommend this printer
customer_reviews.author: Bob

customer_reviews.title: Works well and they stand by their warranty
customer_reviews.text: I owned the HL-L2300D for almost a year before it died. I contacted support and they sent me a replacement quickly, at no cost, so I am very pleased. Print quality is fine for documents. It is mostly used for printing documents and the automatic duplexing is great.
customer_reviews.author: James

customer_reviews.title: No USB Cable comes with this printer!!!!!
customer_reviews.text: For $20 less I got this model HL-L2300D-- it is hardwired not wi-fi but we have difficulties with our Canon and the wifi so we decided to go hardwire. They didn't provide the cable...so order the USB 2.0 Cable Type A/B 6' for $4.99 through Amazon or you will be pissed...I know I am...and you lost a star for not telling us in BOLD print that it wasn't included. After a few months of use the printer is still going strong. On my second toner but it does the job well. I choose gray ink for my less important docs to extend the life of the ink.
customer_reviews.author: C. P.

customer_reviews.title: The printer is very compact and quiet when printing.
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this laser copier to replace an old inkjet printer. I have to say the results are really outstanding. The printouts are very fast and extremely clean. The issue I had with smudging from the inkjet is nonexistent with this printer. The two-sided print feature works very well. The printer is very compact and quiet when printing. The only drawback is that it does not print from Wi-Fi. I have purchased a second printer which has the Wi-Fi feature but have not removed it from the box because I'm really happy with this printer.
customer_reviews.author: Brian Dixon

customer_reviews.title: Black Streaks
customer_reviews.text: Worked great for two months, but now I get these thick, horizontal, black streaks across the pages. I've tried cleaning it like the instructions say, but nothing. I've even tried printing half a ream of paper to see if it would clear up, but no. Even tried switching cartridges, but that didn't help either. It has been suggested that I replace the drum, but after just 2 months, I'm afraid it may happen again.
customer_reviews.author: D. Harris

customer_reviews.title: Affordable, Quality Black and White Laser Printer for Home or Small Office
customer_reviews.text: God &@$#!!! Easy to setup, comes with software, manual, and toner out of the box. Does not include the USB 2.0 A-to-B cable, however. The print quality is just right and once Windows 10 finished setting up the device I printed instantly without issue. Speed of prints really isn't a concern of mine so long as I get quality output. The attached picture was printed on HP premium paper (heavier than regular paper); the HL-L2300D had no problem with that either. Obviously, this printer is black and white only so it's not for people trying to print family photos. So far, I'm happy with this purchase.
customer_reviews.author: Trevor McMullin

customer_reviews.title: Difficult to setup
customer_reviews.text: WARNING: This does not work with Google Chromebooks. I tried and after many successful attempts, I gave up. I am able to print from Windows 10 perfectly fine. When printing from windows 10 it works great, but I initially purchased this to use with my Chromebook.
customer_reviews.author: Andrew

customer_reviews.title: EASY & SOLID
customer_reviews.text: I’ve been in the IT business for15 years and I have dealt with all kinds of printers over the years. Some ok, some not ok and some well... real stinkers! This Brother printer - JUST WORKS!! This is the easiest no-hassle printer that you can buy that is super easy to get installed and working. Literally PnP (Plug and Play) We have a few of these in the office and none of them have given us any issues at all. Read an article the other day where Brother is now the highest rated brand of printers. Yeah, I can believe that.
customer_reviews.author: Rob

customer_reviews.title: Really Great
customer_reviews.text: This printer prints very quickly and can produce a high volume of prints without using much toner as long as you have a good supply of paper. As a writer, I cannot tell you how invaluable a device like this is to my work. On the Canon Printers I was burning through several toner cartridges a month whereas this one will probably yield 9000 sheets before I have to change the toner. This printer is worth every penny.
customer_reviews.author: CH

customer_reviews.title: High quality and low price
customer_reviews.text: This’ll replace my 8 year old brother 1170. It’s definitely been a wonderful workhorse but after stupidly buying an aftermarket replacement drum I realized that for well under a hundred bucks I could get a nice new one. I bought the 2300 because it just lives next to my computer and wi fi was not needed. Have been using for about 10 months. Print quality is very good. Speed is awesome for such a cheap price and like the old one never jams. What more could you possibly want? Terrific. Definitely 5 stars.
customer_reviews.author: smithcover

customer_reviews.title: Sturdy printer, high quality documents
customer_reviews.text: I was able to set up the printer without much effort. The instructions are there, but the steps are intuitive. The toner cartridge is easy to replace. I was impressed by the quality of documents and the ability to print on both sides of a page. My iMac tracks the amount of toner available. Although I don't print many multi-page documents excepting income tax, the device has used relatively little toner over three months. It has been superb for use at home.
customer_reviews.author: TGD

customer_reviews.title: This thing is unusable if you don't have a cd-rom drive
customer_reviews.text: You go to their website and download the full software and it says it installs but who knows where. Go to the User Manual and it says install with the CD-Rom or if you can't then download BRAdmin from your devices downloads page. Go to the download page and it only has the same download available that has already been installed. They don't have 24 hour tech support and I'm not waiting until they get around to emailing me back. Don't buy this POS. I'm finding something else and returning this.
customer_reviews.author: herald25

customer_reviews.title: Reliable, Works Well, Great sleep mode
customer_reviews.text: Man this thing lived up to the hype. Bought it in 2019 for $70, then Covid hit a year later and everyones working from home needing printers for everything and now they go for 180$ used because printers are sold out everywhere and this one is an old reliable plug and play beast. It simply does the job, doesn't have issues with expiring "ink/toner" and plugs right in and prints on windows 10 with no drivers or anything. Just plug it in and its immediately recognized and printing your stuff. I don't know what else to say, this thing is a winner all around man.
customer_reviews.author: Cipherr

customer_reviews.title: Doesn't include the USB cable, which is required to operate it
customer_reviews.text: I'm sure it's a great printer. I don't know. I can't tell because it doesn't include the REQUIRED usb cable. Cutting corners to get the price down is great and all but at least supply the things the printer requires to operate. Terrible.
customer_reviews.author: Gabriel Clason

customer_reviews.title: This will cost you more than the price listed.
customer_reviews.text: This is probably the worst purchase I have made in Amazon. Unfortunately I needed a printer and it is difficult to visit a store right now, all things considered. It literally REQUIRES a cord that it doesn't come with. I have no idea why this would have good reviews.
customer_reviews.author: Charity

customer_reviews.title: Unreliable brand new printer!
customer_reviews.text: Just purchased this 4 months ago, and want to return it, but window closed for return May 31. Very unreliable. Constant error messages. My last printer was HP, lasted 10 years without problems. I regret purchasing this. Will still try to return. Worst laser printer i've ever had.
customer_reviews.author: Valdez

customer_reviews.title: You'll need a C2G-to-USB cable
customer_reviews.text: Whaddaya want for eighty bucks???? I needed a basic, monochrome printer and this SEEMS to do the job. However, on the very first (and subsequent) tries, the paper jammed each time. Unbelievable. So, I fed the paper, manually, through the manual feeder and it printed fine. No big deal to me, I guess ... I print infrequently (save those trees!) so I can deal with the manual feed. But, seriously? Paper jam from Day One? Anyway, I'm glad that I had a C2G-to-USB cable lying around in my box of discarded cables, otherwise I wouldn't have been able to print. For some reason, I thought that this was Bluetooth-compatible. I guess I was wrong.
customer_reviews.author: crimsonkng

customer_reviews.title: Quality is poor. Support is bad.
customer_reviews.text: The printer started to deteriorate in terms of image quality. It started to miss some of the colors. I called tech support. I wasted two hours and the full supply of ink ($46). Every time printer self-cleaned the problem only got worse. And tech support people told me that he can't help me to replace this printer and I have to continue cleaning and troubleshooting. Crazy.
customer_reviews.author: Anton

customer_reviews.title: Love this printer
customer_reviews.text: I love this printer. Gone are the days where I get mad at my kids for printing nonsense documents. Inkjet cartridges are soo expense compared to laser printer cartridges when comparing cost per page printed. I love how quickly the machine warms up and it hasn’t jammed once in 4 months of use. Great image quality
customer_reviews.author: howlin at the moon

customer_reviews.title: Great Printer
customer_reviews.text: I already have this printer and was so pleased with it i purchased another for a family member. My first Brother of the similar model, has been running for over 2 years daily and without any flaws. So purchased this later version for a gift to a family member. Great product and value
customer_reviews.author: Frank

customer_reviews.title: The sweet ride is over... Great printer though!
customer_reviews.text: I love this little printer, unfortunately after having purchased 4 of them it looks like the price just spiked up another 20 bucks, it was good while it lasted. The reason it was such a good deal was the price point, other than that it's a working decent printer but not super extraordinary. I usually just search out the top 10 black and white printers of <insert year here> to know what I'm going to buy that year, looks like it's time to pull another list.
customer_reviews.author: Alex Barnette

customer_reviews.title: Does not include required accessories.
customer_reviews.text: Probably prints ok, once you get it up and running. Unfortunately, brother fails to disclose on the product page that you have to have a USB cable to set it up - and not any of the modern, garden variety USB cables, but the old school behemoths that one rarely finds on new products. Unfortunately, I discarded all of my old 1.0 connectors many years ago. Thanks for the bait and switch Brother. And let's not even get started on the hard page count programmed into your toner cartridges. Do yourself a favor and pay a little more for a product that doesn't cut corners at the customer's expense.
customer_reviews.author: James Berry

customer_reviews.title: Brother makes great inexpensive Laser printers
customer_reviews.text: This is my 3rd Duplex Brother Monochrome Laser printer, the other 2 are 3 and 5 years old and still going strong.
customer_reviews.author: Bob

customer_reviews.title: Buy additional toner ASAP
customer_reviews.text: Thankfully I bought an additional toner as the one that comes with it didn't last very long. The printer just stops and you can shake the toner trying to finish your print job, but it will not start printing again. My last printer was also a Brother. Sadly, I have two new toners for it when it gave up the ghost! I wish they would standardize these toners. The new printer is the same size as the last one.
customer_reviews.author: H. Baker

customer_reviews.title: Best Simple Laser Printer out there!
customer_reviews.text: This is my third one of these in 12 years - my first failed at year 8 (I print THOUSANDS of pages every month) so I bought another. I've now set up a separate office and made sure to get the same printer. These are super reliable, allow duplex printing, are fast and consistent and I LOVE that you can replace the toner separate from the drum extending the life and reducing operating costs. I've tried other printers but I'll never go back!
customer_reviews.author: Amy Washington

customer_reviews.title: Amazing little printer!
customer_reviews.text: I love love love this printer. For $50 it allows me to print clothes patterns at home for much cheaper than going to a copy shop. The print quality isn’t the greatest (according to my husband) but i don’t print anything that the quality needs to be great so it works for me. I don’t have to constantly buy ink and if I’m in a hurry this prints fast. It was super easy to connect my MacBook to and I was up and running in just a few minutes. If you’re looking for a home printer this is the one for you.
customer_reviews.author: Brittany

customer_reviews.title: IT DOESN'T COME WITH A CABLE BUY A CABLE
customer_reviews.text: What kind of sick pleasure do all these printer manufacturers get from leaving the printer cable out? Do they think I have extra printer cables laying around? Why not leave out the power cable too? For some reason, they even include a driver CD, as if it is more likely that I would have a spare printer cable than a connection to the internet. Overall, it is a printer and, boy, does it print.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Efficient Printer
customer_reviews.text: I've had this printer for almost a year. It works well and prints fast. I definitely prefer this laser printer than my prior ink jet printer. The toner in this printer doesn't dry out like ink printers.
customer_reviews.author: hula_dncr

customer_reviews.title: Didn’t work for me
customer_reviews.text: Unfortunately, this product doesn’t appear to be compatible with the Apple laptop I purchased at Christmas. I thought it was wireless, but I guess not. The online video instructions just show how to take it out of the box and do on. I know how to take it out of the box, I just want to print things from my computer!!! It also enclosed a CD which also doesn’t work with a laptop. Too bad.
customer_reviews.author: Kate W.

customer_reviews.title: What a great price for a great printer
customer_reviews.text: Bought our first Brother laser printer years back. Never a jam and all the sudden (after 10 years) it jammed on the second sheet out. found out the parts are more expensive then just buying a new one so got this Brother HL-L2300D on Amazon for $69!!!! the parts to replace my old printer was $60!!!. It's a no brainer and this new Brother printer doesn't disappoint. it's faster and print duplex!!!! I'm just going to buy a new Brother every 10 years
customer_reviews.author: Mike Nguyen

customer_reviews.title: got it shipped to Hong Kong, and after turning ...
customer_reviews.text: got it shipped to Hong Kong, and after turning it on, thick white smoke/steam (i can't tell which) oozed out from the printer. Later on, when turning this printer on, all lights flash, tried installing software on two computers, connecting reconnecting, restarting and idling, still does not work tldr: i think it arrived with mechanical malfunction, tried contacting support but no one got back in 3 days
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Outstanding product!
customer_reviews.text: Purchased this several months ago; Every time I request system to print, it prints with no head games, such as ink jet printers. Even after going over a month of non-use it prints perfect, where as an inkjet I'd most likely have to purchase new cartridge. Virtualised Windows XP and 2000 (XP driver) work correctly on both O/S's. This is massive help as both O/S's are used for specific obsolete software tasks . Will most likely purchase 2nd unit for backup purposes.
customer_reviews.author: Up North

customer_reviews.title: Install on an iMac instantly, works just great!
customer_reviews.text: It took about three minutes to hook the printer up to my iMac, longer than it took me to get it out of the box. I don’t use it very much but it works whenever I need it, not even a hiccup yet.
customer_reviews.author: Salgud

customer_reviews.title: Breaks down easily
customer_reviews.text: Had this about a year and now it's broken. The LED lights - all 4 of them - just continually flash. Nothing has fixed it. Everything checked and unplugged and replugged. It just gives an error without saying what the error is for. And I had just printed something else before sending another regular print job to it. I can't recommend it at all. There is no one to even ask for help regarding the issue. I'll go back to another Epson instead.
customer_reviews.author: Clayton Buerkle

customer_reviews.title: The best printer I have ever purchased!
customer_reviews.text: I will never purchase an inkjet printer again. This laser printer is so much better and is small enough for home use. I have used it occasionally for over 2 years and I still have only used half of the sample cartridge that came with the printer. The pages print clear and very fast and relatively quiet. Be sure to leave a gap for the heat vents in the back and side of the printer, as the instructions state. Stop buying crappy home inkjet printers, which don't work and are more expensive.
customer_reviews.author: Lego

customer_reviews.title: out of the box experience went well.
customer_reviews.text: Worked right out of the box with a relatively simple plug-n-play experience. It took me a minute to figure out how to load the toner cartridge (not as straight-forward as an inkjet technology), but now that I've figured it out it will be simpler in the future I'm sure. So the initial experience was great. We'll see how it works for me in the long run. The reason I bought a laser printer is that inkjet technology worked poorly for my infrequent printing. The cartridges plugged up with infrequent use, which was REALLY frustrating and expensive. Hopefully, the laser jet toner cartridges won't suffer that problem ... but time will tell.
customer_reviews.author: motobojo

customer_reviews.title: No wifi, POS.
customer_reviews.text: Just so frustrated. Look, it doesn't seem to have wifi. I am so use to EVERYTHING having wifi, that I could not understand why it didn't. Even the user manual shows you how to use it by wifi, and yet, it actually can't. WTF. Read other reviews. Apparently it catches on fire? Ick. Have to return. Such a waste of time.
customer_reviews.author: Heath

customer_reviews.title: Doesn't come with the cable to connect to your computer
customer_reviews.text: The printer doesn't come with the nessary cable to connect to a computer. Why wouldn't they make that clear? They have it back because this was a waste of my time.
customer_reviews.author: Why?

customer_reviews.title: Pages Printed
customer_reviews.text: Best printer ever, no need to buy expensive ink cartridges, toner cartridge are cheap for amount of pages printed compared to color printers, I've been able to print over 1400 pages on starter cartridge, no more color copiers for me.
customer_reviews.author: GB

customer_reviews.title: Reliable, but the toner low lockout is a deal breaker.
customer_reviews.text: Will stop working on a schedule. You can either use the reset procedure to use the remainer of your half full cartridge or purchase another tone cartridge that has a new chip. I'm glad I also have an older model that doesn't have that particular 'feature'. I guess they took a page from HP.
customer_reviews.author: Bob Smith

customer_reviews.title: This thing prints like a champ and for not much money
customer_reviews.text: A no-frills printer. Make sure you pick up a USB 2.0 Type A to B cable as this printer DOES NOT come with it. Pro-tip, after installing the drivers but your computer fail to make it print, unplug the USB from your printer to your computer, and plug it back in. It forces your Windows to re-enumerate it properly. After that, it's ready to go! This thing prints like a champ and for not much money. I don't know why I held onto my circa early 2000s HP laserjet for so long. This thing blows it out of the water with performance and value!
customer_reviews.author: T.C.

customer_reviews.title: Happy ... this is my first Brother product
customer_reviews.text: VERY happy. Just be sure to purchase a USB cord, as this does not come with one. Also if you have Windows 10 I would highly recommend visiting this site before you plug the USB into your computer : They removed my link but its the Brother support site... it recognizes what version of Windows that you are using and will recommend the software for you. google the model number and driver... it should get you there [...] . This is what worked for me on Windows 10 Set up was super easy and intuitive. Highly recommend
customer_reviews.author: Sugartown

customer_reviews.title: It is NOT by any means perfect. The toner has smudged on quite a few ...
customer_reviews.text: This printer does okay. It is NOT by any means perfect. The toner has smudged on quite a few of my printed projects by the wheels on the paper feeding roller, and also when the paper prints, and comes up from the tray below, it comes out curled in a "C" shape, and not laying flat. If you can look past those design flaws, and limitations, then this printer will work for you. Set up was quick and easy, because the printer doesn't have any bells or whistles. Just straightforward B&W prints. Not anything astounding.
customer_reviews.author: Desert Mermaid

customer_reviews.title: Great printer for the price
customer_reviews.text: Just right for the occasional print job at home, such as a resume, letters, or tickets to events. We had an inkjet printer before but would never use it often enough to keep the cartridges fresh. Considered getting a wireless but decided this was so economical it was worth the slight hassle of having cords. Some people complain that it doesn't come with a cable, but most people already have one (or many!) if they've ever owned another printer. This wasn't an issue at all for me.
customer_reviews.author: justfitz

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for our needs, duplex is a nice bonus.
customer_reviews.text: Works perfectly, happy so far, ideally would be WIFI-enabled, but then it would cost more. Happy to say the built-in duplex works perfectly. Purchased to support our kids in virtual school activities.
customer_reviews.author: Heather Anderson

customer_reviews.title: Don't buy this printer -- it's a potential disaster
customer_reviews.text: I've used Brother printers for years and they are fabulous. But If I lived by a river I would be thrilled to throw this worthless printer off a bridge and watch it die. Don't waste your money. It is TOTALLY UNRELIABLE. It will work sometimes, but you can't ever count on it. If you work with any sort of deadlines this thing can be a disaster. It'll tell you you have low toner when you don't. It'll tell you you have no paper when you have plenty. Whatever it does, if it tells you anything it won't print!!
customer_reviews.author: Peter M. MacDonald

customer_reviews.title: Great printer, after 9 months of home usage
customer_reviews.text: I already used up the original toner package and got another one. The printer still works great. Simple and small. What I like most is that it is able to print on both sides of the paper.
customer_reviews.author: JS

product_meta.title: Brother HL-L2300D Monochrome Laser Printer with Duplex Printing
product_meta.description:
Style:HLL2300D

Reliable Affordable Monochrome Laser Printer For Personal or Home Office Use. Automatic Duplex Printing, Compact Size, Print Speed Up To 27ppm. High Speed USB Interface.

Media Type - Plain, Bond, Envelopes, Labels; Sheet Weight - Manual Feed (Min/Max) - 16-43 lbs. (bond),
Sheet Weight - Paper Tray (Min/Max) - 16-28 lbs. (bond), Machine Noise (Ready/Printing) - 31dB/49dB,Power Source - AC 120V 50/60Hz
Consumable Type - Toner Cartridge and Drum.
feature_bullets: Prints Up To 27 ppm, Automatic Duplex Printing
250 Sheet Capacity Paper Tray. A4 2-sided print speed-13. A4 standard print speed-26. Automatic 2 sided print.Recommended monthly volume-250 to 2,000 pages

Windows 10 Compatibility: If you upgrade from Windows 7 or Windows 8.1 to Windows 10, some features of the installed drivers and software may not work correctly. Please uninstall all drivers and software in Windows 7 or Windows 8.1 before upgrading to Windows 10
1 Year Limited Warranty With Free Phone Support For The Life Of Your Machine

This machine uses a USB connection ensuring your office runs smoothly with no complications. High Speed USB 2.0 Interface. Does not come with USB cable.Maximum Monthly Duty Cycle: 10,000 pages. Output Paper Capacity (sheets):100
Refer the specification sheet below for contents of package and refer to the user manual for trouble shooting steps.
It prints sharp, professional black and white pages at up to 2400 x 600dpi resolution

specifications.Domestic Shipping: Item can be shipped within U.S.
specifications.International Shipping: This item can be shipped to select countries outside of the U.S. Learn More
specifications.Customer Reviews: 4.3 out of 5 stars3,712 ratings4.3 out of 5 stars
